poem:
**Drone Shadows**

Over airfields,  
the hum of anger,  
uninvited wings  
crossing under clouds—  
Poland's breath held  
between whispered tensions.  
In council rooms,  
chairs take their stance;  
words of urgency  
cast like nets  
into troubled skies,  
seeking the unseen  
paths of whirring night.  
Peace, a whisper,  
lost amid the wind.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russian drone incursion an ‘aggressive, reckless act’, says EU as Poland plans no-fly zone – Europe live 2.43pm BST UN security council meeting on Poland drone invasion confirmed for Friday The UN security council meeting convened at Poland’s request after it accused Russia of violating its airspace with drones will take place on Friday, 3pm local time (7pm BST, 8pm CEST), the South Korean presidency said. The meeting has been endorsed by several other members". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Russian drone incursion an ‘aggressive, reckless act’, says EU as Poland plans no-fly zone – Europe live 2.43pm BST UN security council meeting on Poland drone invasion confirmed for Friday The UN security council meeting convened at Poland’s request after it accused Russia of violating its airspace with drones will take place on Friday, 3pm local time (7pm BST, 8pm CEST), the South Korean presidency said. The meeting has been endorsed by several other members
